articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The Artful Escape developers Beethoven & Dinosaur are following up their musical platformer with another soundtrack-driven narrative game. Mixtape draws on the classic tropes of coming-of-age teen flicks, adds striking stop motion-style visuals and completes the package with a soundtrack that would feel right at home in a John Hughes movie.
Read more
articles.title: Annapurna’s Mixtape is a coming-of-age teen summer adventure with skating, romance and a banging soundtrack

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Microsoft and Blizzard have slapped a release date on Diablo 4's forthcoming content-o-season Vessel Of Hatred. It's out 8th October 2024, and sees you hooting and hollering down the road to the new region of Nahantu in search of Neyrelle, a character "who is both suffering the fate of her choice to imprison the Prime Evil Mephisto, and seeking a means to destroy him". In the process, you may choose to become "the apex predator of the jungle as the all-new Spiritborn class". You can also recruit mercenaries to help you, fight alongside other players in a new PvE co-op activity, "and more".
 Read more
articles.title: Diablo 4 Vessel Of Hatred gets October release date plus trailer which I refuse to watch because it sounds horrid

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl, the long-awaited sequel to the FPS that perhaps emanates the most shame in my backlog, has a new combat-focused trailer showing off the many dangers of the enigmatic Zone. You’ll also be pleased to know that the release date remains the same as the previous announcement: September 5th 2024, where it will be coming to Game Pass day one. Here’s the tray-tray:
 
Read more
articles.title: The Zone is looking deadlier than ever in new S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl trailer

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The rumours of a new Gears of War appearing at today’s Xbox Games Showcase were accurate - well, mostly. The next Gears of War won’t be a sequel like Gears of War 6, but instead looks to be a prequel to the entire series that returns to the very beginning of the bloody battle between humanity and the alien Locust.
Read more
articles.title: Gears of War: E-Day takes the series back to the start of the Locust War, complete with a nod to Mad World

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Microsoft have released a new trailer for South Of Midnight, a third-person action adventure from Compulsion Games, who created dystopian Britpop survival game We Happy Few. I thought We Happy Few had some wonderful ideas and presentation - it's sort of Fable by way of Clockwork Orange and Bioshock - but found its mixture of pill-popping satire and survival game mechanisms self-defeating. South Of Midnight seems no less vivid, but a lot more assured in its God Of War-style action... and it's perhaps a bit less intriguing, as a consequence. Still, don't just sit there reading my opinions. Watch the trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Witchy, swampy action-adventure South Of Midnight gets a proper gameplay trailer with island-sized alligators

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Indiana Jones And The Great Circle, Indy’s upcoming FPS adventure game, has a new ‘Official Showcase Reveal’ trailer, officially showcasing and revealing basically nothing about the game except that it features some pretty and decently acted cutscenes, which we already knew from the previous reveal. It does have snow nazis in however, possibly the rarest flavour of Nazi after Cookies n’ Cream and Original. You’ll find the trailer below. Be careful: it’s official. Also, it’s mainly just one very long cutscene, so if you want to save that stuff for when the game’s out, maybe don’t bother.
 
Read more
articles.title: New Indiana Jones And The Great Circle trailer shows snow nazis making train noises and not much else

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I love me a Flight Simulator, but never more when there's some dramatic structure to my flight. That's why I've long been looking forward to Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. It takes the staggeringly detailed world and flight model of Asobo's Flight Sim revival, and adds a job system on top. And now it has a release date: November 19th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator's aviation career-focused sequel arrives this November

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Max Caulfield is back! The time-bending protagonist of the first Life is Strange is returning in a new entry in the series, Life is Strange: Double Exposure. It’s out this October.
Read more
articles.title: Life is Strange: Double Exposure brings back original hero Max Caulfield for a dimension-hopping murder-mystery this October

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Microsoft and Playground's genuinely long-awaited Fable reboot will launch in 2025, and they've released a new trailer which... seems... good? And is also quite informative about the moment-to-moment of the game. The video is framed as the memoir of a paunchy retired champion, Humphry, who once mentored a young heroine I presume will be the game's main character, though it's ambiguous. She could also be the villain. Then again, Fable is a series in which you can be the villain. Egad, such shenanigans! 

 
Read more
articles.title: Playground's Fable slated for 2025 release - here's a trailer hinting at what it's like to play

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I never played the original Perfect Dark, but the trailer for the reboot shown during this evening's Xbox Games Showcase instantly made it the most exciting game I've seen during not-E3. It's first-person, it's got stealth, it's got parkour, it's got hand-to-hand melee combat including slidekicks. It looks like a mashup of Mirror's Edge and something more immersive sim-y? What's not to like.

 
Read more
articles.title: Perfect Dark reboot resurfaces with stealth, parkour, and spy gadgetry

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Age Of Mythology: Retold, the remaster of the classic strategy beast-em-up, is due to release this year, 4th September 2024 on PC and Game Pass. This will be the 2002 game’s second remaster following its Extended Addition re-release in 2014, and aims to thoroughly spiff up the original with a 3D visual overhaul, new animations and texture, plus UI and QOL improvements. Prevent yourself being seduced by the suspiciously thunder-imbued swan that’s currently chatting you up, and have a gander at the trailer below:
 
Read more
articles.title: Age Of Mythology: Retold swims like a suspicious swan on to PC and Game Pass this September

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater remake - aka Metal Gear Solid Delta - resurfaced during tonight’s Xbox Games Showcase. We still don’t have a release date, despite signs we might see the remake of the 2004 game this year, but we did get a pretty good look at a bunch of key moments from the original remade in the shiny Unreal Engine 5 do-over - including a look at The Boss and the familiar gravelly tones of Snake actor David Hayter.
Read more
articles.title: MGS Delta gameplay trailer gives a first eyeful of The Boss and earful of David Hayter in Snake Eater remake

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Microsoft have published the very first trailer for EA and BioWare's Dragon Age: The Veilguard, formerly known as Dragon Age: Dreadwolf, at their summer Xbox Game Showcase. It accompanies the first details of this "immersive single player RPG" - pause for ecstatic applause from Anthem haters - "where you become the leader others believe in". Not miles from the premise of Dragon Age: Inquisition, then. That footage, tho? Not entirely Inquisitiony.

 
Read more
articles.title: The very first Dragon Age: The Veilguard trailer makes it look like a Fortnite heist movie

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We've known for a while that Starfield was getting its first expansion later this year, but tonight's Xbox Games Showcase gave us its first trailer. My main takeaway? That Bethesda are leaning into cosmic horror, as the trailer features landscapes that look like they're on the other side of an Oblivion gate than anything I saw during my time with Starfield.

 
Read more
articles.title: Starfield's Shattered Space expansion looks to amp up the horror later this year

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
DOOM: The Dark Ages is the next Bethesda Doom game, following DOOM 2016 and Doom: Eternal. It takes the FPS series back to a more civilised medieval age, where men and demon solved their disputes with throwable chainsaw shields, massive dragons, and guns that grind skulls at silly speeds then fire out the bone chips. Feast your face on the trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: DOOM: The Dark Ages comes rampaging in on a chainsaw shield next year

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Those undead just keep on coming back from the grave as Microsoft screen a new trailer for State Of Decay 3, your latest helping of sorrowful yet bloodthirsty zombie-bopping survivalism. I reviewed State Of Decay the first and thought it was a cool scrappy underdog next to larger zombie-botherers such as Left 4 Dead or DayZ. State Of Decay 2, on the other hand, I found to be disappointing - the same game with more money behind it in a way that seemed to magnify its faults. The threequel? I have tempered expectations, but I do want it to be good.
Read more
articles.title: State Of Decay 3's latest trailer goes for the emotions with a big makeshift cleaver

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 will release this October, including a day one launch on Game Pass, with an open beta on the way - and it’s certainly looking like a Call of Duty game.
Read more
articles.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 sets a release date for the end of October, open beta on the way

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! You likely already know that books are made from trees, but did you know that Kindles are made from discarded tree asset packs? My uncle, who is a tree, told me that. This week, it's the one and only author and games-worder-abouter, Alice Bell! Cheers Alice! Mind if we have a nose at you bookshelf? 


 Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: author and games writer-abouter Alice Bell

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for finishing up Godzilla Minus One now its on Netflix. I’m not shilling Netflix here, but I am happy to shill Godzilla. Before I shout “It’s Godzilla! That’s Godzilla! It’s him!” every time Godzilla is on screen, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I wrote about the Wholesome Direct earlier this evening and pulled out a handful of games I liked from the showcase. I didn't mention the game I liked most, because I wanted to give it this fuller shoutout. Lost And Found Co. is a hidden object adventure game set in a colourful, densely detailed world, and there's a demo available to play now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Lost And Found Co. is a hidden object adventure in which you play as a duck-turned-human intern

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Finals is a multiplayer first-person shooter about stealing cash and demolishing buildings in a virtual reality game show. Why does it need to be set in a virtual reality game show? So it can do things like transport players to Kyoto in the year 1568, which is what will happen when season three arrives on June 13th.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Finals season three takes its destructive players to 16th-century Kyoto next week

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The advertising bonanza formerly known as E3 continues into its second day with another set of streams. The Wholesome Direct was today's highlight, in my mind. The yearly collection of games that may or may not be cosy, but which definitely do not involve stabbing men in the neck, always contains some games worth keeping an eye on. This year was no different, and you'll find the archived stream below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Wholesome Direct 2024 featured an hour of delightful-looking games, cosy and otherwise

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Busy week, this one. We've had a whole load of games announced over the past few days, and there'll doubtless be a whole lot more this weekend. Most of them we can't play yet. But as a general rule, talking about games makes us want to play games, even if they're completely unrelated. Everyone has those moments where they see the trailer for a new multiplayer hero shooter or some such thing, and for reasons only known to themselves, they say, "yes, I really must play more Simpsons: Hit And Run." So: here's what we're all clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Computer Artworks' 2002 videogame adaptation of 1982 movie The Thing was a ghoulish and gripping third-person shooter with some terrific mechanics that weren't quite fleshed out, flesh being the operative word. For instance: you can enlist surviving soldiers as squadmates, but are they really surviving soldiers, or are they human-shaped warrens of teeth and mandibles poised to split open and shower you in digestive juices? You have a limited supply of blood tests with which to determine whether any people you rescue are Things in waiting - and even as you're worrying about them, they're casting suspicious eyes at you, care of some embryonic "trust" and "fear" systems.
Sadly, much of this acute paranoia could be easily gamed out in practice - back in 2002, I deduced that contact with enemies increased the odds of infection, and adopted a policy of shooting anyone who'd been in my squad for too long. But it's the kind of system an intelligent remake could pounce upon and have fun with. Sadly, Nightdive are not working on a remake, like their previous System Shock remakes. They've just announced that they're making a remaster, due later this year. Still, I will take a Thing remaster and thus, the opportunity to write more about The Thing, over no remaster at all.
 Read more
articles.title: System Shock remakers Nightdive Studios are remastering The Thing

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
A goat or a lamb - which makes the better sacrifice? Trick question, it's neither. The best sacrifices are old rich people. In Cult of the Lamb's next update, Unholy Alliance, you can sacrifice folks with a pal. The upcoming free update will add a co-op goat character so a friend can indoctrinate and stab alongside you. The developers have shown off the two-player update amid the summer news plague that is threatening to tear entire branches off the RPS treehouse this week. "Summoned by blood and born in corruption, this wicked new ally can join the holy Lamb in local co-op," say publishers Devolver. Ah, local co-op. Not online then. I guess this is for real-life people with real-life friends and a proper real-life sofa. Well. Good for them. I'm happy for them. Couldn't be happier. Happy happy happy.
Read more
articles.title: You can play Cult of the Lamb with a friend in a local co-op update this summer

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The news panamax has come in and all the shipping containers are spilling off the deck in an uncontrollable catastrophe of trailers. Here's another: you may remember The Crush House, the colourful 90s reality show where you film the cast by day, trying to please the audience, and creep around by night, trying to investigate the unsettling true nature of the show. No? You don't remember? Well, it has been a long year. Never mind, The Crush House now has a release date. But I'm not telling you what it is until you come watch the new trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Leery first-person reality show The Crush House steps into the limelight in August

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Wet chunks of summer games news continue to shower down on us like an explosive blast of whale viscera. But look, this bit of news blubber is quite good. Philosophy-obsessed puzzler The Talos Principle 2 is getting a big three-part DLC expansion, and some of the environments look lush. Not least this humongous cube sticking out from the sands of a tropical island at a jaunty angle. It is called the Hexahedron, and its interior constitutes a “large, continuous puzzle cluster” that the player will navigate. As one of those dweebs who has walked around London saying “aha, brutalism” at every insignificant piece of concrete he sees, this pleases me. Come and see it up close in the trailer. 
Read more
articles.title: Would you look at the size of this puzzle cube in The Talos Principle 2’s upcoming expansion

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Door-and-peace-minus-the-peace FPS Anger Foot, the best game ever made, has finally got a release date: July 11th 2024. This is spectacular news, mainly because I’d already printed off a load of shirts that said ‘Anger Foot GOTY 2024.’ I was going to do some socks, too, but I do not trust this game anywhere near footwear.
 
Read more
articles.title: Door disrespecting FPS Anger Foot is out July 11th

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The creators of Hyper Light Drifter are not ones to rest. In the terrifying tidal wave of trailers that continually washes over us this weekend, they send word of a new game via the Devolver Direct. Possessor(s) is a side-scrolling character action game of mysterious sci-fi horror set in a "quarantined city ripped apart and flooded by an interdimensional catastrophe". This is coming on top of the already-announced Hyper Light Breaker. Please, Heart Machine, pace yourselves. I barely have time to play the daily crossword.
Read more
articles.title: Possessor(s) is a side-scroller from the folks behind Hyper Light Drifter

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Pow! Biff! Dead! Cells! Catch that plate I just threw you! And this one! Oh no, there’s another plate coming toward you, also thrown by me! And look, you don’t have any free hands left to catch this one! Eat plate! You have been well and truly beaten up, but that’s fine. Here’s something nice to take your mind off the pain. Tenjutsu is a new fluid and frenetic punchy-dudey action game from Dead Cells designer Sébastien Benard. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Tenjutsu is a speedy and stylish beat ‘em up from Dead Cells designer

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Capcom's series about big beasts and the clothes you can skin/steal from them continues in Monster Hunter Wilds, which looked as great as ever in its newest trailer from tonight's Summer Game Fest show. We get new peeks at some lovely dunes, reptile-chicken mounts and bulky weapons. Oh, and some monsters ripe for huntin', presumably.

 
Read more
articles.title: Monster Hunter Wilds' new trailer shows sick cutscenes and lizard-worms that are gonna make even sicker pants

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
This year’s Day Of The Devs boasted an entire seven exclusives, plus a load of other nifty features and previews for exciting indies we already knew about, but are no less excited to be reminded of. It’s been over ten years now since Tim Schafer and the folks at Double Fine kicked off the non-profit initiative to help shine a spotlight on games what they thought were nice. No way! I love games what I think are nice! Here’s everything from Day Of The Devs 2024, dutifully arranged for your clicking pleasure.
Read more
articles.title: Everything announced and featured at Day Of The Devs 2024 in one place

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Enough moons ago to qualify as quite a lot of moons but not so much for me to categorise them as ‘many’, Alice Bee wrote about an Itch game called Kevin Costner’s Waterworld - a fully playable extrapolation of a Simpsons’ joke from three decades ago. Simpsons jokes from three decades making up most of my sense of humour, I of course thought it was brilliant. And yet, I couldn’t shake a singular, burning question: What if this, but not joke? Enter Tides Of Tomorrow. Ok, so I actually don't know if it has anything in common with Waterworld aside from having lots of water everywhere. Still, I'll never pass up an opportunity for a crispy Simpsons reference.
 
Read more
articles.title: We’re finally getting our big budget Kevin Costner’s Waterworld game in Tides Of Tomorrow

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
UFO 50 is a collection of fictional retro games designed as if they were made for a non-existent games console 40 years ago, but in reality have been developed as brand new titles for an upcoming collection from indie devs including Spelunky creator Derek Yu. With the ambitious project nearing a decade in its own development, though, those games have now taken on their own real history in addition to their made-up one. Those histories will meet this September, when UFO 50 finally sees the light of day.
Read more
articles.title: Spelunky creator’s mega-collection of fictional retro games UFO 50 will finally be out this September

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Before we get to the latest trailer for S-Game's soulslike Phantom Blade Zero I have a couple of complaints to lodge about the title. Firstly, this game clearly contains a non-zero quantity of blades, from whacking great axes to katanas. Secondly, I do not accept the premise that these are phantom blades. They are very obviously non-spectral, going by the amount of stabbing and clanging on show in the video. With these potentially ruinous caveats out of the way, I am now free to tell you more about a game that looks like it's out to eat Sekiro's lunch.
 
Read more
articles.title: Latest Phantom Blade Zero trailer sure makes it look like an over-powered Sekiro

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Are Tamagotchis a thing now again? I’m getting a sense they might be, but I’ll always associate them with the nineties. Ah, to return to a simpler time, where kids tripped each other up in the school hallways to steal toys , before Pokémon cards came along and everyone leveled up to stabbings. Sorry, Petal Runner devs, for opening a news article about your lovely wholesome game talking about stabbings. This gorgeous, fuschia-splashed, slice-of-life RPG is, if anything, the antidote to stabbings. In terms of game fatigue, anyway. It won’t cure tetanus, at least I don’t think so.
 
Read more
articles.title: Petal Runner is a slice-of-life Gameboy Advance style RPG about being a digital pet courier

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
When the Summer Game Fest trailer for "narrative-centric cosy game" Wanderstop said it was from the creator behind The Stanley Parable, I thought I had surely entered a different dimension where The Stanley Parable was actually a wholesome shop-keeping sim rather than a zig-zagging office-based nightmare. Then Wanderstop started to get rather bleak, and I finally stopped pinching myself. See for yourself.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Stanley Parable co-creator announces a tea-brewing sim that's secretly not-so-cosy

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Things that weren’t on my Summer Game Fest bingo card: a surprise appearance from I Think You Should Leave’s Tim Robinson. Things also not on my Summer Geoff Fest bingo card: that Tim Robinson would show up to reassure us that, yes, Skate is still in the works.
Read more
articles.title: The new Skate resurfaces with a surprise Tim Robinson appearance, snippets of gameplay and plans for a playtest expansion

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Grid-based puzzler Grindstone was a favourite of Katharine’s, who found it to be her go-to during regularly scheduled moments of “cat-based paralysis”. I didn’t spent quite so many hours of feline enforced stasis with it, but I too was drawn in for a respectable time chunk. It’s those detail-stuffed visuals and caffeinated animations that tipped it for me, and it’s the same art that have me excited for Capybara’s follow-up. Battle Vision Network is an online puzzle battler that pits you head to head against real-life humans (boo those guys). The conceit here is its a televised space sport, in which you’ll steer the fate of its ongoing story arcs by winning or losing as your chosen team.
 
Read more
articles.title: Battle Vision Network is a competitive match-three puzzle battler from the makers of Grindstone

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Palworld is getting a lot of new things! I’m going to write the names of these new things now. I really hope they mean something to you. I want you to have nice things. Here are the new things coming to Palworld: a new island. Some new Pals. A new level cap. A new arena. A new subspecies. A new raid. A new oil rig stronghold. A new faction and boss. Maybe some other, secret things? All this newness comes as part of the ‘Sakurajima’ update, which releases on June 27th, 2024.
 
Read more
articles.title: Palworld’s Sakurajima update adds a new island and lots more and I can only assume that’s a good thing

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Night Springs is a fictional TV show within the world of Alan Wake 2, so of course that's also the focus of the meta-horror action game's expansion. It's three episodes, and it's out in under 24 hours.

 
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake 2 is getting a three episode Night Springs expansion tomorrow

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Among Us developers Innersloth have announced Outersloth, a fund for independent game developers, alongside a bunch of games funded by the aforesaid fund for independent game developers. They all look rad, and Outersloth itself is a cool initiative.

 
Read more
articles.title: Among Us devs reveal indie game fund Outersloth alongside new games from the creators of Celeste, Venba and Thirsty Suitors

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Warframe-like “Next-gen looter shooter” The First Descendant releases this Summer, July 2nd 2024. The ‘next-gen’ part probably refers to Unreal Engine 5, and fair’s fair, it’s a real looker this one. The below trailer is mainly scripted or edited bits, but having played a chunk of the last technical test, there’s some genuinely impressive sci-fi vistas to behold, as well as some absolutely massive bosses. Click on the trailer below, until the purple hat or whatever it is you kids grind for these days, pops out with a synapse-tickling noise workshopped by psychologists for eighteen months.
 
Read more
articles.title: The First Descendant brings Warframe style looter shooting this July

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
I’m not familiar with the proto-internet cartoon Killer Bean, but Graham assures me it’s fairly important in the history of online animation. Regardless, I’ve been won over by the upcoming video game of the same name from original creator Jeff Lew, which looks to blend together Just Cause stunt shenanigans, John Woo slo-mo gunfights and the energy of a third-person action game you would’ve found in a bargain bin for the PlayStation 2 in 2002. It’ll hit early access this summer, courtesy of a fresh look from tonight’s Summer Game Fest showcase.
Read more
articles.title: Roguelike shooter Killer Bean brings its mix of Just Cause physics, Matrix gunfights and PS2 energy to early access this summer

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In what is only the third ever piece of videogame-related media to make me weep at my keyboard, Volgar the Viking devs and retro specialists Digital Eclipse have announced a Power Rangers videogame - Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Rita's Rewind. It's a 90s-style 2D brawler for up to five players, involves "time twisting", and has mode-7-esque arcade shooter bits together with its own spin on the TV show's climactic mecha transformation sequences.

 
Read more
articles.title: Digital Eclipse are making a new Power Rangers game with extreme Sonic Mania energy

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
A French game about mountain climbing? No, not that one. This is Cairn, not Jusant, and it’s actually a very different beast. Jusant could be tricky, but climbing was more the way you experienced its story. In survival climber Cairn, the ascent is the story. It seem to mainly be a story about how bad you are at climbing.
 
Read more
articles.title: Mountain climber Cairn is like Death Stranding meets an unforgiving Jusant

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Z průzkumu, který projekt FreeBSD provedl v poslední době mezi svými uživateli, vyplývá řada zajímavostí. Podívejme se blíže, jak se dnes typicky FreeBSD používá i jaký je jeho uživatel.
articles.title: Uživatelé hodnotí FreeBSD v roce 2024: přidat na komunitě, díky za ZFS a stabilitu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: Disketovka k osmibitu byl dříve nedostižný sen, tak jsem si jednu koupil. V poslední části se budeme věnovat postupu, jak vytvořit vlastní disketu a také, jak se projeví použití cartridge Fast Load.
articles.title: Commodore 1541-II: vytváření vlastních disket a použití cartridge Fast Load

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Pipeline je v současném IT jedno z nejzneužívanějších slov. V jazyku Coconut lze pipeline používat ve smyslu kolon, tedy pro zajištění předávání návratových hodnot funkcí do jiných funkcí, což je základ tacit programmingu.
articles.title: Konstrukce kolon a kompozice funkcí v jazyku Coconut

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: The Mirror, alternativa ke hře Roblox, uvolnil svůj zdrojový kód. Neoficiální port hry Zelda se jmenuje 2 Ship 2 Harkinian. Klasika Descent 3 od Outrage Entertainment je nyní k dispozici pod svobodnou licencí.
articles.title: Hra The Mirror je open-source, klon Zeldy se jmenuje 2 Ship 2 Harkinian

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V dnešní sklizni se ponoříme do světa komunikace, bezpečnosti a prezentací. Představíme si nástroje, které vám umožní udržet kontakt s vaším sociálním okruhem, ochránit vaše digitální data a prezentovat vaše myšlenky v terminálu.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (12. 6. 2024): jedna aplikace na všechny komunikační sítě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 6. června proběhlo tradiční setkání k příležitosti Dne IPv6. Přechod na internetový protokol nové generace nepřináší jenom technické výzvy (o kterých se také mluvilo), ale i řadu organizačních překážek.
articles.title: Česko samo přechod na IPv6 nezvládne, trh to nevyřeší, říká Ondřej Filip

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: V dnešním vydání postřehů se podíváme na masivní únik dat Ticketmasteru, několikastupňový útok na Ukrajinu, spolupráci čínských skupin na kyberšpionážní kampani nebo malware Decoy Dog útočící na Rusko.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: spolupráce čínských skupin a zero-day v TikToku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Edice openSUSE Aeon Desktop RC2 získává nové funkce. Opera ve spolupráci se společností Google představila novou funkci, která uživatelům umožňuje generovat obrázky pomocí umělé inteligence. Ubuntu 23.10 končí podpora.
articles.title: Aeon Desktop se formuje, Opera bude umět generovat obrázky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Google posílá do projektu Mesa podporu Fuchsia OS, 40 let od uvedení původního Tetrisu, OBS Studio 30.2 Beta přináší nativní podporu NVENC, 70 let od úmrtí Alana Turinga.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.1 blíže, OBS Studio s podporou NVENC na Linuxu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Mezi všemi těmi Apple Silicony a Qualcommy Elite X by člověk mohl přehlédnout, že x86 se má stále k světu. Po Computextu už ale ne, jak AMD, tak Intel ukazují světu, co za skoky vpřed chystají.
articles.title: AMD Zen 5 a Intel Lunar/Arrow Lake se představují: závěr roku ve znamení x86

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mozilla dostala od Roskomnadzoru požadavek, aby ve svém obchodu permanentně zablokovala pět doplňků, které jsou zneužívány k obcházení cenzury v Rusku. Šlo o Censor Tracker, Runet Censorship Bypas, dvě VPN služby Planet VPN a FastProxy. Vlastní VPN od Mozilly je dostupné jen ve 33 státech a Rusko mezi nimi není (u nás ano).
articles.title: Mozilla blokovala v Rusku doplňky, které obchází cenzuru. Nyní už vše funguje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V sobotu policie zatkla tureckého studenta, který podváděl u standardní zkoušky TYT na univerzitě v jihozápadní provincii Isparta. Podvod byl sofistikovaný. V botě měl ukrytý router s přístupem na internet. Otázky snímal kamerou zamaskovanou jako knoflík a odpovědi mu umělá inteligence četla přímo do sluchátka v uchu.
articles.title: Turecký student podváděl u zkoušky na univerzitě pomocí AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Evropské centrum pro digitální práva noyb podává stížnost na Privacy Sandbox v Chrome. Ten si uživatelé mohou zapnout od loňského roku (opt-in), což by mělo funkčně nahradit sledovací cookies třetích stran. Ty snad budou již příští rok vypnuté?
articles.title: noyb podává stížnost na Privacy Sandbox v Chrome

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: AMD Fast CPPC (Collaborative Processor Performance Control) je vlastnost procesorů Zen4 a novějších, která umožňuje rychlejší přepínání frekvencí procesoru. To jednak zvyšuje výkon a také snižuje spotřebu.
articles.title: AMD Fast CPPC bude v jádře 6.11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Poptávka po IT odbornících v oblasti kvality a testování softwaru roste. Vývojáři se snaží psát kód tak, aby fungoval správně, ale mohou přehlédnout některé chyby. Taková chyba ale může způsobit velké problémy. Tester je proto nepostradatelnou součástí vývojového procesu a je zásadním prvkem vývoje softwaru. Dívá se na software z pohledu uživatele a pomáhá vše ladit k dokonalosti.
articles.title: Testing Akademie: naučte se testovat kvalitu softwaru v online kurzu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nový AI pomocník do Windows 11 Recall měl vyjít již příští týden 18. června. Recall ukládá snímky obrazovky, aby si uživatel mohl později najít, co na počítači dělal. Uživatelé však novou funkci nepřijali s nadšením, mají obavy o své soukromí.
articles.title: Kontroverzní Recall ve Windows 11 měl vyjít již příští týden, ale bude odložen na neurčito

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Google oznámil přechod ChromeOS ze standardního linuxového jádra na jádro ze systému Android. Důvodem je integrace frameworků z Androidu s cílem jednoduše používat aplikace z Androidu v ChromeOS bez mezivrstev.
articles.title: ChromeOS opouští čisté linuxové jádro

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Canonical dnes zveřejnil informace o počítači DC-ROMA RISC-V II od společnosti DeepComputing. Půjde o osmijádrový notebook s procesorem využívajícím architekturu RISC-V, na kterém bude předinstalovaná linuxová distribuce Ubuntu.
articles.title: DC-ROMA II bude osmijádrový notebook s RISC-V a Ubuntu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Nadace FreeBSD Foundation zveřejnila výsledky průzkumu v komunitě FreeBSD, ve kterém se snažila zjistit zajímavé informace o uživatelích FreeBSD a jejich způsobu používání tohoto operačního systému. Průzkum obsahoval 50 otázek a zúčastnilo se ho 1446 uživatelů.
articles.title: Komunita okolo FreeBSD vidí ZFS jako nejcennější serverovou funkci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Rok po vydání openSUSE Leap 15.5 byla dle očekávání vydána nová verze 15.6, která představuje dílčí aktualizaci s plánovanou podporou do konce roku 2025, což by mělo dát uživatelům dostatek prostoru pro přechod na tak trochu revoluční verzi 16.
articles.title: openSUSE Leap 15.6 vylepšuje podporu kontejnerů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Společnost Vodafone krátce po blokaci domén datoid.cz a datoid.sk začala blokovat domény edisk.cz a sledujteto.cz. Uživatelům se stejně jako v předchozím případě zobrazuje informace, že je web blokován na základě zákona o hazardu.
articles.title: Vodafone blokuje domény edisk.cz a sledujteto.cz na základě předběžného opatření

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nové vydání balíku systemd je na světě a s ním již dříve avizovaná implementace náhrady za sudo, tedy nástroj run0.
articles.title: Nová verze systemd 256 s run0, systemd-vpick či importctl

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Vedení organizace ICANN dnes v rwandském Kigali oznámilo, že následující ICANN Policy Forum proběhne příští červen v Praze. Jedna z vrcholných akcí organizace ICANN se do Česka vrátí po třinácti letech a sdružení CZ.NIC bude opět jejím hostitelem.
articles.title: Praha opět přivítá jednu z tradičních konferencí organizace ICANN

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: HTTPS se stává běžným, většina webů už ho nasadila. Jak to ale udělat správně, opravdu bezpečně a hlavně bezbolestně? Na školení HTTPS pro správce serverů si ukážeme si nejnovější trendy, prakticky si vyzkoušíme vygenerování certifikátu a nasazení na web server.
articles.title: HTTPS pro správce serverů (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jsme na cestě, hlásí Koichiro Iwao o AlmaLinuxu a Raspberry Pi 5. Práce na podpoře poslední generace malinového stroječku založili vývojáři na obrazech pro předchozí verzi. Koichiro konstatuje, že jádro systému použité v buildech AlmaLinuxu pro Raspberry Pi typicky zakládá na jádru, které v rámci CentOS připravuje Pablo Greco. Pak už „jen“ stačilo naučit se bootovací proces a rozdíly mezi čtyřkou a pětkou.
articles.title: AlmaLinux s podporou Raspberry Pi 5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Kolem Intel oneAPI loni na podzim vystavěná nadace UXL (Unified Acceleration Foundation) ve spolupráci s Khronos Group oznamují další logický krok: oficiálně běžící spolupráci The Khronos Group, stojící mimo jiné za standardy OpenGL A Vulkan, a samotné UXL Foundation.
articles.title: Nadace UXL (oneAPI) navazuje spolupráci s Khronos Group

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Společnost Tuxedo hodlá v budoucnu nabídnout i notebook postavený na ARM SoC Qualcomm Snapdragon X Elite. Prototyp ukázala na letošním Computexu, šlo o 14palcový stroj s displejem o rozlišení 2560×1600 s 32GB LPDDR5X pamětí a PCIe 4.0 NVMe SSD.
articles.title: Tuxedo připravuje linuxový notebook se Snapdragonem X Elite

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Počínaje Firefoxem 127, jenž již leží hotový na FTP serverech Mozilly (novinky budou časem shrnuty v obvyklém přehledu, prozatím vezměme zavděk beta verzí), se bude 32bitová verze pro Linux tvářit navenek jako „x86_64“, a to ryze kvůli skutečnosti, že 32bitových instalací už je tak malé množství, že by sama tato informace mohla přispívat k fingerprintingu daného uživatele.
articles.title: Firefox 127 předstírá u 32bitové verze, že je 64bitový

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Dorka Volavkova)
articles.description: V čtvrtek 13. června začíná v Brně na FIT VUT třídenní konference DevConf.CZ. Vstup na konferenci je zdarma, ale je nutné se registrovat. Zbývá už jen pár míst, proto doporučujeme se registrovat co nejdříve. Pokud se nemůžete zúčastnit osobně, konferenci můžete sledovat také živě prostřednictvím youtubového kanálu.
articles.title: Konference DevConf.CZ 2024 začíná tento týden

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V PHP od verze 5.x byla před měsícem ve Windows objevena kritická zranitelnost CVE-2024–4577. Chyba může způsobit vzdálené spuštění kódu. Zranitelné je PHP-CGI, ale může být zneužito, i když není nakonfigurováno. Stačí aby php-cgi.exe bylo v adresáři, kam se dostane webserver. Zranitelné jsou tedy patrně všechny výchozí instalace XAMPP na Windows.

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
We're officially only one week away from the release of Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. As such, Bandai Namco has shared a full release schedule for every timezone, informing players when exactly they can jump into the expansion.


Now, the release does vary slightly depending on whether you're playing on consoles or PC. For anyone based in the U.S., Shadow of the Erdtree will launch on June 20, and the console version won't be available until six hours after the PC version. Here's a simple breakdown of all the major U.S. timezones:





Pacific Time (PT):

PC: June 20, 3 p.m.


Consoles: June 20, 9 p.m.




Central Daylight Time (CDT):

PC: June 20, 5 p.m.


Consoles: June 20, 11 p.m.




Eastern Time (ET):

PC: June 20, 6 p.m.


Consoles: June 21, 12 a.m.





As for U.K. players…
articles.title: Here’s when you can start playing Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree in every region

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
I really enjoy playing through Monopoly GO's events. While I find Peg-E fun, my true joy comes from Partners events. With Tycoon Racers becoming available worldwide for the first time this week, I was curious how it compares to some of my favorite events and whether I'd have a blast with it.


So far, I'm enjoying Tycoon Racers a lot, but there's a glaring issue that I'm conflicted on: the difficulty. There are many competitive people out there, and for a group of casual players who rarely have more than a few hundred dice on them at a time, it's almost intimidating to see. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


Unlike Partners events with very clear milestones that can snowball your progress, Tycoon Racers feels like a constant uphill battle, with no guarantee that you'll get anything out of it. …
articles.title: Monopoly GO’s Tycoon Racers event is an interesting yet brutally challenging concept

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
Destiny 2's recent Final Shape expansion brings a lot of new weapons to the table that seriously shake up the meta. The Ergo Sum sword for example is an exotic secondary Sword that you can farm to get a god roll on, which is something virtually unheard of before. One such weapon that's been extremely popular has a god roll as well, though it can be tough to nail that down. Here's the god roll for The Call in Destiny 2, including perks and attachments.


The best perks, barrel, and magazine for The Call in Destiny 2


The way The Call is designed implies that this weapon will become your new primary, so how we're building this is to deal with add clear while having some respectable elite damage. Naturally, you'll want to mainly use your heavy weapon against things like bosses, while your secondary is a wildcard. With those goals in mind, you'll want to take the following perks and attachments:



Barrel - Quick Launch


Magazine - Tactical Mag


Perk 1 - Lead from Gold


Perk 2 - Desperate Measures



On the barrel side of things, Quick Launch helps to compensate for The Call's rather low projectile speed. The Tactical Mag, meanwhile, is a bunch of flat buffs all around that help improve some of the weapon's drawbacks a bit. As for perks, Lead from Gold always pairs well with Special ammo weapons that are meant to be primaries. That extra ammo is a godsend at times. Desperate Measures also provides some extra damage, and is especially useful in grenade/melee builds like some of the meta Prismatic builds right now. If you want, One for All is a nice alternative since you'll be hitting a lot of enemies fast with The Call.

The post Destiny 2 The Call god roll – Best perks and attachments appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Destiny 2 The Call god roll – Best perks and attachments

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
While many weapons were introduced with Destiny 2's The Final Shape expansion, some of the most interesting are the Dealer's Choice weapons. These weapons are fairly good on their own, but when paired together can increase the rate that your super charges at. I run a build using them myself, and I get my super back alarmingly fast. One such weapon is particularly interesting thanks to its role in your arsenal. Here's the god roll for the No Hesitation auto rifle in Destiny 2, including attachments and perks.


The best perks, barrel, and magazine for the No Hesitation in Destiny 2


The No Hesitation is interesting due to its Support Frame perk, which causes hip-fire bullets aimed at teammates to heal them. This heal is incredibly strong, sending a guardian from red health to full in less than a second. Since it's so strong, we want to take perks that further its role as a healing machine.



Barrel - Fluted Barrel


Magazine - Flared Magwell


Perk 1 - Physic


Perk 2 - Circle of Life



The combination of Fluted Barrel and Flared Magwell is an iconic pairing for any weapon, providing stability, reload speed, and handling by a significant amount. Physic provides restoration whenever you rapidly heal allies, and you'll be doing that a lot, making these two a natural pairing. Circle of Life allows for some increased damage after providing healing to your teammate, which helps since you need to deal damage to consistently heal your teammates. Subsistence is a good alternative in the first perk slot if you feel that the restoration is a little overkill.

The post Destiny 2 No Hesitation god roll – Best perks and attachments appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Destiny 2 No Hesitation god roll – Best perks and attachments

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
During the warm up to the Final Fantasy XIV Live Letter from the Producers 82 on June 14, Toshio “Foxclon” Murouchi showed off his shirt and let slip that there will be multiple designs coming in a collaboration with clothing brand Uniqlo. 


The shirts were previously announced back in April, but we got another look at them at the end of today's Live Letter, after almost four hours of exciting Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail reveals. The designs will be available for purchase in Japan on June 17, coming to stores worldwide a week later on June 24. 


Image via Square Enix


Despite being in the Live Letter, not all of the designs featured on the Uniqlo website are based on Final Fantasy XIV. The line includes designs based around Final Fantasy XVI and the Pixel Remaster series, too. 


There are seven designs coming in total, each with a different design. The one that Foxclon can be seen wearing in today’s Live Letter features three chibi minions - Alpha, a Moogle, and Fatcat - emerging from the chest pocket, while others include quotes and iconic imagery from the long-running Final Fantasy franchise. 


Image by Destructoid


Director Naoki Yoshida can be seen wearing another of the Uniqlo designs in today’s Live Letter, this one featuring a full-front design of the Warrior of Light standing in front of an intricate sketched vista. 


Another design, this one taking inspiration from Final Fantasy XVI, includes all eight of the Eikons who appear in the game, depicted in rainbow colors on the back of the shirt. On the front, peeking out of the front pocket, is a single Phoenix feather.


The best part about these shirts is the fact that they’re all relatively inexpensive. Each shirt will cost you $24.90 USD / £19.90 GBP.  Each shirt comes in sizes from XS to 3XL, so there really is something for everyone in the collection.

The post New Final Fantasy x Uniqlo designs are on their way this summer appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: New Final Fantasy x Uniqlo designs are on their way this summer

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
With Black Ops 6 firmly on the horizon, fans of Call of Duty's battle royale Warzone are already thinking about what it means for the mode. Many want to see the number of guns slashed, begging Treyarch and Raven to remove MW2 and MW3 guns permanently. 


When Modern Warfare 3 was released, many thought that the guns from the previous year's game would be removed. This wasn't the case, however, with guns carrying through from the old gun, and all the guns from the new one added in too. 


This meant there was well over 100 guns to choose from, which sounds good in theory, but ends up becoming messy, especially when the old guns are so weak compared to the new ones that there's no point in using them. 


A lot of guns in Warzone right now. Image via Activision


In a post on the Warzone subr…
articles.title: Warzone players want one major thing removed when Black Ops 6 update releases

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Drago Entertainment has released a new trailer for the Motel Simulator, one of the next games in the shared simulator universe they’re building around Gas Station Simulator. On top of that, they’ve also provided some screenshots of Road Diner Simulator and reminded us that the Junkyard Cars DLC is still on the way for Gas Station Simulator.


This teaser is one of the first looks into the game (not featuring actual gameplay) and is one of the few real announcements made about the game in over a year. It essentially pans across a shady highway motel before zooming out and replacing it with a more flashy and modern one in a sequence that reminds me of The Sims (the first one).




It tells us very little. I’m interested to know if the little meth lab trailer is actually a gameplay mechanic. …
articles.title: New teaser shows Drago’s Motel Simulator still exists

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Once in a while, Fortnite experiences various bugs and errors that cause its servers to stumble. It's a natural part of an online game's cycle, yet it's still scary if you've dedicated time to it and fear that you got banned or the servers closed. The "failed to download supervised settings" error is one such issue you might encounter, but fortunately, there are ways to fix it in some circumstances.


How to fix the "Failed to Download Supervised Settings" error in Fortnite


In most cases, Fortnite's failed to download supervised settings error comes from its servers being offline due to a new update or an unexpected bug. Occasionally, Fortnite experiences server or login outages, which can cause you to be unable to join. Fortunately, this usually means the servers will return soon, so yo…
articles.title: How to fix the “Failed to Download Supervised Settings” error in Fortnite

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Summer has always been a hype time for video games thanks to all the industry showcases. Summer Game Fest, the Xbox showcase, and a few others highlighted some incredible titles for everyone to look forward to, but we mustn't forget that the industry as a whole is in serious turmoil. In fact, as of this week, there have been more layoffs in the past six months than in all of 2023.


As spotted by Polygon, this is according to a blog by technical artist Farhan Noor that tracks industry layoffs. While these are only estimated figures, the data highlights how dire things are at the moment. By the end of 2023, approximately 10,500 people working in the games industry lost their jobs. There were early signs that these cuts weren't going to slow down in 2024 and, as of this week, an estimated 10…
articles.title: The games industry has already laid off more people this year than in all of 2023

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
While it might not be making as many headlines as it did early on, Valve's seminal PC gaming handheld, the Steam Deck, is still going strong. It's just received a new operating system update, in fact, delivering a few key improvements while the infamous SteamOS 3.6 looms in the background.


The June 13th update for the Steam Deck's "Stable" update channel is now out, as per Valve's recent announcement, and it's got some really interesting improvements. Highlights include the per-device wake-up toggle being added to the OLED Deck's functionality roster, as well as the ability to check a specific Bluetooth device's battery level. This is all well and good, of course, but it's also worth remembering that the SteamOS 3.6 update has been hovering about in the "Unstable" update channel for some…
articles.title: Steam Deck gets a minor new OS update, but the big improvements are pending still

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
Helldivers 2's new update has delivered an awesome assortment of tweaks, fixes, improvements, and new content that hasn't gone unnoticed by the community. Its most important feature, though, was the long awaited enemy patrol fix, and something might've gotten broken along the way, from the look of things.


Specifically, it would appear that even though Arrowhead Games certainly did do something with the logic behind Helldivers 2's enemy patrol spawning, it's definitely not the way it used to be before the prior major update. In fact, some players have reported that they're now coming across even more enemy forces than ever before, which is about the opposite of what was supposed to happen. The issue is so pervasive, in fact, that even Arrowhead Games' community manager has chimed in, prom…
articles.title: Helldivers 2 players say patrols are still overbearing, despite fixes

articles.author: Drew Kopp
articles.description:
The Annecy Animation Festival gives animators a stage to showcase their latest projects. There have already been many great reveals this year, but Cartoon Network has made one of the strongest showings by unveiling a series of upcoming spin-offs/revivals of some of the best shows the channel has ever aired.


All of Cartoon Network's announcements are blasts from the past


Warner Bros. Discovery has been vocal about its plans to pour most of its resources into its pre-existing IPs. While I'm a little frustrated to see yet another company take the safe route and fall back on its established brands rather than try something new, I’d be lying if I told you that I'm not excited by all of the projects the company announced at Annecy.


I grew up watching Cartoon Network and its retro-themed si…
articles.title: Every New Cartoon Network Show Announced at Annecy Animation Festival

articles.author: Elliott Gatica
articles.description:
Warframe has weekly Twitch raffles and drops when you watch their Prime Times or the monthly Dev Streams, so it’s ideal if you play regularly to link your account to the streaming site. You may also want to link it now as Tennocon 2024 is coming up and it’s going to have some huge giveaways.


How to link your Warframe account to Twitch


To link your Warframe account to Twitch, log into the official Warframe site. It does not matter if you log in through your Nintendo, Xbox, or PlayStation account. As long as you log in to your main account, this is what you’ll need for the next step. 


With this done, now click on your account on the top left of the screen. On mobile, it should be the same process. Click on Account Management and proceed. 


Here, you should find a section that says “Link Your Twitch Account” which should show you that you can get the free Broca Prominence Syandana if you do. If you are already logged into your Twitch account on the browser you’re doing this all on, it should all be done very easily.


If not, you just have to enter some login credentials related to your Twitch account. Once everything is done, you should receive the Twitch success page on the Warframe site. 


Now when you hover over your account on the top left of the Warframe website, you should see “Twitch - Linked” right below Cross Platform Save. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


Warframe Twitch account link benefits


With your account now linked to Twitch, there are quite a few benefits besides the free Syandana. First, you can now participate in streams to get Drops. Typically, the Warframe Twitch Drops consist of some kind of resource or item for watching 30 consecutive minutes of a stream.


These typically happen on Prime Times or Dev Streams. However, with Tennocon events and other big gaming events, you can oftentimes expect to get a whole free Warframe by watching these said events. 

The post Warframe Twitch link: How to link your Warframe account to Twitch appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Warframe Twitch link: How to link your Warframe account to Twitch

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Metal Slug Tactics has been parked on the horizon for what feels like an eternity. First announced back in 2021, it’s perhaps due to my excitement that a few years have felt like an age. It’s almost here, however, and I’ve had the opportunity to try it out and see if all the suffering was worth it.


If you aren’t familiar, Metal Slug Tactics is a spin-off of the venerable 1996 arcade classic. As the name implies, Leikir has transplanted the run-and-gun gameplay to the grid-like fields of a turn-based strategy game. And while those two genres are vastly different, there is very little in this world that can’t be improved with the presence of Fiolina Germi.


Screenshot by Destructoid


The narrative of Metal Slug Tactics is hardly surprising. Mainstay antagonist, General Morden, has escape…
articles.title: The Metal Slug Tactics demo shows promise, also Fio

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Given the anticipation for the long-awaited Steam releases of the Kingdom Hearts games, it should come as no surprise to hear that they're selling well. In less than 24 hours, the HD 1.5+2.5 ReMIX compilation has rocketed up the platform's sales charts and is currently the top-selling Steam game, outperforming even Helldivers 2 and Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance, the latter of which only launched today.


While the series has been available for PC owners via the Epic Games Store since 2021, Steam users have obviously wanted to see it launch on their platform of choice. I have to imagine a decent number of these sales are a result of established fans buying the games again (I should know, I'm one of them). Aside from them being playable on Steam Deck, Square Enix is discounting the whole s…
articles.title: Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5+2.5 becomes the top seller on Steam in less than a day

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
The Final Shape, eh? It's pretty good, right? All jokes aside, Destiny 2: The Final Shape is genuinely solid. And that's coming from someone who was deeply disappointed with the prior Lightfall DLC and, in particular, its seasonal offerings. So, has Bungie kickstarted a renaissance of Destiny 2?


To explain where this is all coming from, it helps to be aware of the leadup to The Final Shape's release, and of the general history of Bungie's Destiny 2 offerings. Two things to talk about before we get to discussing the very crux of the issue, then. You'll thank me later!




Screenshot by Destructoid


The Final Shape and the problems that helped shape it


The Final Shape is, in many ways, an all-encompassing response to issues that Destiny 2 had been having well in advance of its release. …
articles.title: Is Destiny 2: The Final Shape the franchise renaissance we’ve been waiting for, or just another outlier?

articles.author: Darrus Myles
articles.description:
Alloy Smelt is an event in Wuthering Waves all about combat. The higher your score in each stage, the better the rewards, so here's a guide on how to clear each one for maximum profit.


How to beat all Alloy Smelt Rifts in Wuthering Waves


In total, there are 10 total Rifts (Levels or Stages) to complete in the Alloy Smelt event. Each Rift highlights a specific game mechanic that is pretty much required to abide by if you want to earn all of the rewards. The Characters and Echoes you use can make a Rift super easy or incredibly difficult, so paying attention to the details is important for the best results. For your reference, I'll walk you through each stage, and explain the setups you need to beat them with ease on the 'Difficult' difficulty setting.


Breath Rift


Image by Destructoi…
articles.title: Wuthering Waves – Alloy Smelt event guide

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
Yars Rising was recently announced as a follow-up of sorts to Atari 2600 classic Yars' Revenge. Rather than taking the form of a Zorlon Cannon-blasting shooter, Yars Rising is a hacking-centric Metroidvania with a demo now live during Steam Next Fest. As odd as the concept is, after playing some of what WayForward has in the works, I'm willing to hear them out.


This time around you take control of Yar — okay… so far, so good — which is the hacker handle for a young woman named Emi Kimura. A mysterious patron has hired Emi to hack her way into the shady corporation known as QoTech, and in true Metroidvania fashion she'll do so through exploration that expands with every new technique she picks up along the way. It's all presented in a clean, but somewhat stiff aesthetic that's serviceable…
articles.title: Yars Rising stretches its ties to the Atari classic, but somehow kind of works

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
Treyarch has confirmed that sniper rifles in Black Op 6 will be incredibly powerful, and fans of the Call of Duty series are celebrating before they've even gotten the chance to play it. 


In an interview with VentureBeat, when asked about how Black Ops 6 and Warzone would work together, Treyarch Associate Director Matt Scronce stated: "I was just talking to my lead weapons designer about shots to kill on sniper rifles yesterday. In Black Ops 6 multiplayer, for example, all of our sniper rifles are one shot torso up."


"Obviously you'll have different characteristics as far as slow fire, fast fire, recoil. But we'll talk across the studios. We're all very aware of what we're doing. There's a goal of consistency, but there's also a goal of doing what's right for each experience. 


Sniper…
articles.title: Black Ops 6’s snipers are going to be incredibly powerful, and fans love it

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Euro 2024 competition kicks off later tonight. Meanwhile, EA hosted a set of simulations on EA FC 24 to try and predict the winners.


Of course, this isn't the first time EA's taken a shot at predicting winners using its sports sim. In 2022, EA Sports shared something similar in FIFA 23 regarding who would go on to win the FIFA World Cup. Interestingly, the simulation was spot on as Argentina went on to lift the trophy in Qatar. Now, EA FC 24 is picking England as the simulated victor.


EA FC 24 simulation predicts England as Euro 2024 winners


England is one of the stronger squads in Germany, and Southgate's unit has a blend of youthful talents and seasoned veterans who can beat anyone on their given day. EA FC 24 seems to believe that The Three Lions could finally win the coveted Euro 2024 tournament. 




Interestingly, EA Sports has yet to give the breakdown of the entire tournament (which was available in 2022). The developers have only announced the results of the final showdown, which puts England against hosts Germany. It appears that Harry Kane will have an important say, as he scored the final goal in the simulation to help England win in the sim.


In reality, both Germany and England could qualify for the finals and go on to lift the trophy. However, it will be challenging as some strong contenders might want to change this prediction. Nations like France, Italy, and Spain won't be pushovers, and there are plenty of emerging contenders who could stake a claim for the trophy as well.


While fans will need to wait till July 14 to know who wins in real life, they can create their own story in the EA FC 24 Euro 2024 mode. EA Sports has introduced plenty of interesting content in Ultimate Team as well; the Path to Glory promo is about to end, but Make Your Mark cards are coming soon.

The post Who wins the Euro 2024? EA FC 24 simulation predicts surprise winners appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Who wins the Euro 2024? EA FC 24 simulation predicts surprise winners

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Despite it being over nine years since Bloodborne launched on PlayStation 4, fans have not given up on demanding that Sony port the game to PC. If not Sony, then developer FromSoftware and the game's director Hidetaka Miyazaki. In fact, Miyazaki was recently pressed on his own feelings on a PC port and while he's not opposed to the idea, he stopped short of saying if he himself wants it to happen.


PCGamer recently got to interview Miyazaki about the upcoming Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, and so it took the opportunity to quiz Miyazaki once more on Bloodborne for PC. In past interviews, Miyazaki has refrained from discussing Bloodborne specifically since FromSoftware doesn't own the IP. But when asked if he personally wants Bloodborne on PC, Miyazaki admitted that other members o…
articles.title: Bloodborne on PC still isn’t happening, but its director isn’t opposed to the idea

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
After 264 days, one of Fortnite's most popular skins is back, and if you want to get your hands on it, we can tell you how to unlock and wear the skin. 


Syd was first added to the game in July 2022, but was removed from the Item Shop just days later. It has returned to the store six times since then, but never for very long, meaning that if you didn't get it in that window, you were out of luck. 


Nine months since Syd's last appearance, the character has finally returned as part of Fortnite's 30.10 update, and here's how you can get it. 


Back after 264 days. Screenshot via Dot Esports


How to get the Syd Fortnite skin


The Syd Fortnite skin is currently available in the in-game Item Shop, and can be purchased for 1,200 V-Bucks. 


Along with the skin, you also get two additional skin styles, a LEGO Fortnite skin, and the Cuddlebear Cutie back bling. Not bad for 1,200 V-Bucks. If you want even more content, the Beary Cuddly Bundle includes all of the above, plus the Weighted Spikegloves pickaxe and the Heartwave weapon wrap. 


How long is Syd going to stay in Fortnite?


According to Fortnite.gg, Syd will stay in the Item Shop until June 27, when it will disappear again. Of course, this hasn't been confirmed by Epic, but gives you a rough idea of when it will be removed. 


If you want this skin and are definitely going to buy it, I'd recommend getting it as soon as possible, as you don't want to wait another 264 days for the chance to buy it. 

The post How to get Fortnite’s Syd skin appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get Fortnite’s Syd skin

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Between the likes of Castlevania, Arcane, and upcoming projects like the Among Us cartoon, we really are living in a golden age of animated TV shows based on video games. And now we can add fighting game Guilty Gear Strive to the list as developer Arc System Works has announced its own anime series titled Guilty Gear Strive: Dual Rulers.


Details are incredibly slim, with the teaser website only showing new artwork of series protagonist Sol Badguy and Sin Kiske, while a mysterious new character looms over them in the background. What we do know is that Guilty Gear creator and character designer Daisuke Ishiwatari is involved, and the show is being made at Sanzigen, a studio that specialises in 3D animation. Sanzigen was also responsible for this incredible looking one-year anniversary sho…
articles.title: Guilty Gear Strive is getting its own anime and you know it’s going to look amazing

articles.author: Jovan Krstić
articles.description:
Updated: June 14, 2024


We searched for new codes!




The world is on the brink of collapse as the war between humans and Demons wages on. Will you fight back against the wretched Demon army or join them to bring an end to humankind? Once you've chosen your destiny, use Demon Blade codes and lead your faction to victory.


Redeeming codes in Demon Blade will give you Cash, EXP boosts, and Race Spins to help you level up faster, unlock more powerful weapons, and hone abilities. If you're looking for more free rewards in other Demon-Slayer-inspired games, check out our list of +1 Blade Slayer codes and stock up on valuables in no time.


All Demon Blade codes list


Workin…
articles.title: Demon Blade codes (June 2024)

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
As you embark on the Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance journey, be prepared for a series of pivotal decisions. The first of these will confront you right at the beginning, offering two paths: 'Take her hand' or 'Don't take her hand.' This choice is not to be taken lightly, as it will shape your entire experience in SMT V: Vengeance. We're here to guide you toward the most beneficial outcome.


SMT V: Vengeance take the hand decision guide


When you reach out to the body in the early cutscenes of SMT V: Vengeance, a voice will tell you that this girl is not ready to exist quite yet. You'll choose to either reach out to her or ignore it. Grab the girl's hand to experience the new storyline, Canon of Vengeance. On the other hand, don't grab the girl's hand if you wish to check out SMT V's original narrative, Canon of Creation. Newcomers may be inclined to take this route to see what events transpired in the original version. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


Although Canon of Vengeance could be seen as the 'evil route,' it's the only way to access the brand-new story. This pathway may involve more morally ambiguous choices and darker themes. It'll still follow a similar route to the original but with a few twists and turns. Vengeance's new character will also join your party frequently, resulting in exclusive dialogue and cutscenes. She's honestly a pretty good ally to have and can make battles much more accessible.


Even if you're a beginner, you can still take the hand if you so desire. Like most SMT entries, Vengeance is a standalone experience, meaning you can enjoy the new content without feeling lost or overwhelmed by the game's lore or previous entries. Of course, it's entirely up to you to make the final decision. Plus, the game allows you to revert your choice at this point if you happen to change your mind. 

The post Should you take the hand or not in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Should you take the hand or not in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance?

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance pits you against several new enemies, separate from those in the original storyline. Naamah is one of the first bosses you'll need to eliminate during The Angel's Trail quest. We're here to help guide you through Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance's Naamah boss battle with a few tips and tricks.


Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance Naamah boss guide 


Although Naamah is a part of Vengeance's early stages, she can be ruthless if you don't prepare for it. To get ready for this battle, I suggest loading up on Amrita Sodas or having an ally that cures status ailments. It would help if you also got your party around Level 18, the same ranking as Naamah during this showdown.


Naamah has a weakness to Physical Attacks but is resistant to magic. That means abilities lik…
articles.title: How to defeat Naamah in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Every time you advance further in Da'at, the elite Qadištu group will always try to stop you in your tracks. Naamah will be one of the first members you encounter, followed by the sinister Eisheth. Here's how to defeat Eisheth in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance. 


SMT V: Vengeance Eisheth boss guide


Before you face off against Eisheth in SMT V: Vengeance, it's crucial to prepare your party. She will be at Level 28, so ensure your team is at this ranking first. I always like using Auto Battle to make the grind feel less tedious.


Eisheth is weak to Force attacks and is resistant to Dark and Fire strikes. Equipping skills like Zan and Mazan can significantly damage her. Use the World of Shadows' Essence Fusion to obtain these talents from the demons, giving you a confident edge in the ba…
articles.title: How to defeat Eisheth in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Choosing the right party members can be difficult, especially when there is a wide variety to select from. We're here to help you narrow down your choices by showing you the best Demons to use in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance.


What are the best Demons to use in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance?


During the beginning stages of SMT V: Vengeance, your choices for Demons are reasonably limited. However, you'll stumble across even more fiends as you get farther into the story. For our best-of list, we'll start out with the best Demons to use in the early parts of the game and then gradually work up through the higher levels.


Neko Shogun


Screenshot by Destructoid


Although you may be distracted by Neko Shogun's adorableness, this Demon is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. …
articles.title: Best Demons to use in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Although you would think combat is one of the most challenging aspects of Vengeance, the game's quizzes can often be a tough nut to crack. You'll encounter these tests a few times, primarily when asking a Demon to join your crew. However, the side quest, In Pursuit of Knowledge, takes this a step further by asking a series of difficult questions. Here's how to complete In Pursuit of Knowledge in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance.


All answers to In Pursuit of Knowledge quest in SMT V: Vengeance


In Pursuit of Knowledge's quest start can be found above the Jouin U. Medical Research Lab in Azabu. Speak to the Jouin Student to begin the test. Then, select the following prompts to get the correct answers in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance's In Pursuit of Knowledge mission:



The demon Onmoraki is a monstrous bird with a human face. What is its original form?

Human corpse




Amongst the hierarchy of demons, what is the name of the evil spirit from which the word "demon" originates?

Cacodaemon




What should you do to remove the omelet-loving spirit Aitvaras from your home?

Light a candle





Whenever you pick the wrong answers in the In Pursuit of Knowledge quest, the Jouin Student will send you away until you've chosen the correct one. No matter what, players will earn the same rewards, regardless if they've picked the wrong selections.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Completing the In Pursuit of Knowledge in SMT V: Vengeance earns you the Treacherous Order Periapt. This allows two demons of the Dark to utilize a Law alignment, offering the Magatsuhi Skill. The Treacherous Order Periapt provides a large amount of MP to all allies and a '1 Press Turn' icon to your next turn. You can use demons from the Vile and Raptor races to make use of this skill.

The post How to complete In Pursuit of Knowledge in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to complete In Pursuit of Knowledge in Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Minecraft's 1.21 update, also known as the Tricky Trials update, introduced the Trial Chambers, mace weapon, and various reward items to spice up the game. However, to access these features, you'll need to know where to find the trial chambers and what to expect as you explore them.


Where to find a Trial Chamber in Minecraft


There are three ways to find trial chambers in Minecraft:



Search around the world on foot.


Buy a Trial Explorer map from a cartographer villager.


Teleport using console commands.



Trial Chambers are structures you'll find by digging underground, much like how you'd encounter an Ancient City or mineshaft. Unlike lush caves, nothing in the overworld indicates when you're approaching one. Instead, you'll have to look out for tuff bricks as you're mining, as t…
articles.title: How to find a Trial Chamber in Minecraft

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Developer Arc System Works has revealed Guilty Gear Strive: Dual Rulers, an anime adaptation based on its hit 2021 fighting game. Though there's no release date or window in sight, Arc System Works says Sanzigen Studios is producing the anime. Notably, Sanzigen Studios is the same studio behind protagonist Sol Badguy's "Find Your Way" music video in Guilty Gear Strive. 

As for what to expect from a plot perspective, Arc System Works has revealed little, though it says Dual Rulers will be at this year's Anime Expo 2024 in July. 

"Shigeru Morikawa (famous for Argonavis the Movie: Axia) will direct," the Dual Rulers announcement reads. "Others attached to the project include Guilty Gear writer Norimitsu Kaihō for series composition and Seiji Mizushima (famous for Mobile Suit Gundam 00, Fullmetal Alchemist) as associate producer."

Here's a look at Dual Rulers' key art: 

What do you hope Dual Rulers is about? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Guilty Gear Strive Anime Adaptation Called 'Dual Rulers' Announced
